component.text:
Congratulations! Your conversion is correct.

Click Next to continue.

Once we know the size of a file or folder, it is possible to determine the number of bytes being used. For example:

A file is 20 KB in size:

1KB = 1,024 Bytes.
20 * 1024 = 20,480 bytes in the 20KB file.

This information can be used to determine the number of bytes total that can be stored.

For example if the 20 KB file is stored in a 1 MB folder (1MB = 1,048,576 bytes of space); then approximately 50 additional files of the same size can be placed in that folder as well, for a total of 51 files (1,048,576 / 20,480).

If the amount of storage needed for an average song is 10 MB, how many songs can be stored in an MP3 player that has 512 MB of storage capacity? How many songs can be stored in an MP3 player that has 1GB of storage capacity?

Enter a value and unit of measure to convert it to a new unit of measure.
